title: Path resolve problem when using Dataset.get in Python
body:
#### What is the problem?

I got the `path does not exist` message when using `Dataset.get()` in Python.

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?

Here is the **example code**:

```Python
import os
import glob
import datalad.api as dl

data_path = "data"
luke_path = os.path.join(data_path, "luke")
dl.clone(source="https://gin.g-node.org/ljchang/Localizer", path=luke_path)

ds = dl.Dataset(luke_path)
file_list = glob.glob(os.path.join(luke_path, "*", "fmriprep", "*", "func", "*tsv"))
file_list.sort()
result = ds.get(file_list[0])
```

Here is the output of `file_list[:2]`:

```shell
['data/luke/derivatives/fmriprep/sub-S01/func/sub-S01_task-localizer_desc-confounds_regressors.tsv',
 'data/luke/derivatives/fmriprep/sub-S02/func/sub-S02_task-localizer_desc-confounds_regressors.tsv']
```

And here is the final **output** (omit the normal part):

```shell
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
IncompleteResultsError                    Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_3718224/1016972536.py in <module>
     10 file_list = glob.glob(os.path.join(luke_path, '*', 'fmriprep', '*', 'func', '*tsv'))
     11 file_list.sort()
---> 12 result = ds.get(file_list[0])

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/distribution/dataset.py in apply_func(wrapped, instance, args, kwargs)
    482             elif i >= ds_index:
    483                 kwargs[orig_pos[i+1]] = args[i]
--> 484         return f(**kwargs)
    485 
    486     setattr(Dataset, name, apply_func(f))

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py in eval_func(wrapped, instance, args, kwargs)
    481                     return results
    482             lgr.log(2, "Returning return_func from eval_func for %s", wrapped_class)
--> 483             return return_func(generator_func)(*args, **kwargs)
    484 
    485     ret = eval_func(func)

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py in return_func(wrapped_, instance_, args_, kwargs_)
    474                     # unwind generator if there is one, this actually runs
    475                     # any processing
--> 476                     results = list(results)
    477                 if return_type == 'item-or-list' and \
    478                         len(results) < 2:

~/miniconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/datalad/interface/utils.py in generator_func(*_args, **_kwargs)
    459 
    460             if incomplete_results:
--> 461                 raise IncompleteResultsError(
    462                     failed=incomplete_results,
    463                     msg="Command did not complete successfully")

IncompleteResultsError: Command did not complete successfully. 1 failed:
[{'action': 'get',
  'message': 'path does not exist',
  'path': '/media/xxx/DATA/yyy/kinship/data/luke/data/luke/derivatives/fmriprep/sub-S01/func/sub-S01_task-localizer_desc-confounds_regressors.tsv',
  'refds': '/media/xxx/DATA/yyy/kinship/data/luke',
  'status': 'impossible'}]
```

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?

```
DataLad version: 0.15.1
git-annex version: 8.20210804-g7961c5a98
OS: Ubuntu 20.04 focal
Python version: 3.9.5
```

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?

Looks like that dataload resolved the wrong `path`, but the `refds` is correct (from the output log). The source code structure is complex so I can't find where is wrong.

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)

No, it's the first time I use DataLad.
